result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Francis Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CM281 and 15CM477.
Defendant to report to Probation, bond continues until Defendant reports. 

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CM281 & 15CM477

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM214, 15CM281 and 15CM477
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 9:00 a.m. to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
- Maintain residence in the State of Wisconsin
- Update the court within 24 hours of release of current address
- If enrolling in a treatment facility or desire to move out of state, needs to submit request in writing to the court for approval
- Starting Sunday May 22,2016 must seek work at the rate of 5 jobs per week and submit proof to the court. 
- Must maintain employment

15CM477:

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Benoy    9:48  ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail.   INCLUDES 15CM480, 15CM477, 15CM281 & 15CM214.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM214, Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM281 and Guilty to Count 1 in 15CM477.   DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM477, Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM281 and Guilty to Count 1 in 15CM477.   On motion of the State, Crt reads in for restitution purposes and dismisses 15CM480.  Court dismisses Cts 2 & 3 in 15CM281. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

15CM214: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200

15CM281: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200

15CM477: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200
- 46 days credit

- restitution $550; joint and several with Robert Carroll (15CM498)
   DF has 10 days to verify restitution amount and file objection

per Defendant's bond. eif
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Amanda Manahan.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: CAR, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail.
